text: i just enabled your portal for the beta, please reach out in this channel with any questions/feedback!

my mistake, i thought there was info within the context to differentiate between the two. i'm going to update the `context` to include an `endpoint` and a `method` property. as a temporary workaround, you can use a query parameter to differentiate
follow up question - why do you want to use the same `file` for these two different endpoints?

Hello all,
Can you please help me?

Can I access as a terminal in HubSpot platform for installing node packages?

Thanks!!

please see the docs for our current beta which includes node package management: <https://docs.google.com/document/d/e/2PACX-1vRGX60V2wQ2Co9X1NO73hkLObcQdNWp2i49XE-pY_DRS6UjZnv4UuODz4nsI_g1gUIXFC1MhN4AFsnZ/pub>
if you're interested, please sign up using the form in that doc and we can enable the beta features for your portal

<@UEKMY50SU> Adding parameter to context will definitely resolve my issue . Thanks for noting this out!

Actually I have planned to create an application in HubSpot and it would require me to create multiple functions for that application.so for more organised way I would like to create similiar kind of functionalities functions in one file.

Like there is one controller in Laravel which contains all functions for one type functionality.

Could you please tell me when I would be able to use that temporary parameter?

Thanks!

<@UEKMY50SU> Thanks for enabling the service.
I have tried to implement this <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-webpack-serverless-boilerplate>
and i was getting the error "module not found".since you have enabled my portal now then i have checked again but i am getting the same error.

I am attaching the screen shots of code files and error .please check.

It would be very helpful if you can share any article or video regarding how to install and use these third party packages

Thanks!
you also need to upload a `package.json` file with the NPM packages you want.

<@UEKMY50SU>
I have used the upload command to to upload my previous example in <http://HubSpot.it|HubSpot.it> also includes package.json but still i was facing the above error.

Now i have deployed your recommended app in HubSpot too but here i am unable to use the hs functions deploy command with which i cannot access the endpoints .could you please tell me how can i use the hs functions deploy command.altough i can see the full project with all files in HubSpot.

but when i use hs functions list command it donot see these serverless functions in that list as i am unable to use the deploy command.
what version of the CLI are you using
you may need to install `@HubSpot/cli@next` to get access to these commands

Thanks you so much for helping me out <@UEKMY50SU>.This was the last problem that was stopping me to use  third party packages in HubSpot.
I have reinstalled the <@US2SSCXL4>/cli@next and then all commands worked smoothly.

Hi,
How I can create custom function using command line.
One more question, How I can start server for all functions simultaneously in localhost?
